title: Statistics (ST)
description: Comprehensive GATE Statistics assessment covering General Aptitude and Core Statistics subjects. This assessment includes 10 aptitude questions (15% weight) and 55 core statistics questions (85% weight) following the official GATE pattern.
whatIsDescription: GATE (Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering) Statistics is a national-level examination that primarily tests the comprehensive understanding of various undergraduate subjects in statistics including Probability Theory, Statistical Inference, Regression Analysis, Design of Experiments, Sampling Theory, Stochastic Processes, and Multivariate Analysis. This assessment follows the official GATE pattern with General Aptitude and Core Statistics questions.

typicalCareers.title: Research Statistician
typicalCareers.description: Advanced statistical research positions in academia and industry

typicalCareers.title: PhD Candidate
typicalCareers.description: Pursue higher studies in statistics and related fields

typicalCareers.title: Data Scientist
typicalCareers.description: Senior analytical roles in data science and machine learning

whoShouldConsider: Students seeking admission to M.Tech/M.E programs in statistics
Professionals looking for PSU jobs in statistical fields
Researchers in statistics and related fields
idealTraits: Good understanding of statistical principles and methods

aptitude.title: General Aptitude Assessment
aptitude.description: Test your general aptitude including verbal ability, quantitative aptitude, and analytical reasoning skills. This section carries 15% weight in the total assessment.

questions.text: If the code 'MATH' is written as 'NBUI', what is the code for 'STAT'?
questions.subject: Verbal - Letter Shift
questions.explanation: Each letter shifted +1: S→T, T→U, A→B, T→U → 'TUBU'.

questions.text: Ratio: Two numbers are in ratio 3:5. Their sum is 64. Larger number is?
questions.subject: Quantitative - Ratio

questions.text: Complete series: 2, 4, 8, 16, ?
questions.subject: Quantitative - Series
questions.explanation: Geometric progression doubling each term → next=16*2=32.

questions.text: 12% of what number is 18?
questions.subject: Quantitative - Percentage

questions.text: Choose the synonym of 'ABRIDGE':
questions.subject: Verbal - Vocabulary
questions.explanation: Abridge means to shorten.

questions.text: A car travels 180 km in 4 hours. Average speed?
questions.subject: Quantitative - Speed
questions.explanation: Speed=180/4=45 km/h.

questions.text: If 2x+7=15 then x=?
questions.subject: Quantitative - Linear Equation

questions.text: Which is correctly spelled?
questions.subject: Verbal - Spelling
questions.explanation: Correct spelling: 'Occurrence'.

questions.text: Average of six numbers is 10. If one number is 16, average of remaining five is?
questions.subject: Quantitative - Average
questions.explanation: Sum=6*10=60. Remaining sum=60-16=44. Avg=44/5=8.8 ≈ 8.8 so closest option 9.

questions.subject: Quantitative - Series
questions.explanation: Arithmetic progression with d=7 → next=28+7=35.

core.title: Core Statistics Assessment
core.description: Comprehensive assessment of core statistics subjects including Probability Theory, Statistical Inference, Regression Analysis, Design of Experiments, Sampling Theory, Stochastic Processes, and Multivariate Analysis. This section carries 85% weight in the total assessment.

questions.text: If X~Binomial(n=10,p=0.5), what is E[X]?
questions.subject: Probability - Binomial
questions.explanation: Mean of Binomial= np =10*0.5=5.

questions.text: For X~N(0,1), P(|X|<1) approximately equals?
questions.subject: Probability - Normal
questions.explanation: Empirical rule: ~68% within 1 SD.

questions.text: Poisson(λ) distribution: Var(X)=?
questions.subject: Probability - Poisson
questions.explanation: For Poisson, mean=variance=λ.

questions.text: If X and Y independent, Var(X+Y)=?
questions.subject: Probability - Variance
questions.explanation: Independence → Cov=0 so Var sum = sum variances.

questions.text: Sample mean of n i.i.d. with mean μ has expectation?
questions.subject: Sampling Theory
questions.explanation: E[bar X]=μ.

questions.text: Which estimator is unbiased for population variance σ^2?
questions.subject: Estimation
questions.explanation: Sample variance with (n-1) denominator is unbiased.

questions.text: Correlation coefficient between X and Y ranges between?
questions.subject: Regression - Correlation
questions.explanation: Pearson correlation ∈[-1,1].

questions.text: In simple linear regression Y=β0+β1X+ε, least squares estimator of β1 is?
questions.subject: Regression - Estimation
questions.explanation: β1^ = Sxy/Sxx = Cov(X,Y)/Var(X).

questions.text: Chi-square distribution with k degrees has mean?
questions.subject: Distribution Theory
questions.explanation: Mean of χ^2(k) is k.

questions.text: t-distribution with ν degrees: mean equals?
questions.subject: Distribution Theory
questions.explanation: Symmetric around 0; mean 0 for ν>1.

questions.text: Likelihood ratio test compares?
questions.subject: Hypothesis Testing
questions.explanation: LRT is used for nested models (one is special case of other).

questions.text: If X~Exponential(λ), mean =?
questions.subject: Continuous Distributions
questions.explanation: Mean of exponential = 1/λ.

questions.text: A random sample of size n from Uniform(0,θ). The MLE of θ is?
questions.subject: Estimation
questions.explanation: MLE for θ is maximum observation.

questions.text: Which sampling method uses clusters?
questions.subject: Sampling
questions.explanation: Cluster sampling divides population into clusters and samples whole clusters.

questions.text: ANOVA: In one-way ANOVA, F-statistic compares?
questions.subject: Design of Experiments
questions.explanation: F = MS_between / MS_within.

questions.text: Which test is nonparametric?
questions.subject: Nonparametric Methods
questions.explanation: Wilcoxon rank-sum is nonparametric alternative to two-sample t-test.

questions.text: If Cov(X,Y)=0 then X and Y are?
questions.subject: Covariance
questions.explanation: Zero covariance implies uncorrelated; independence is stronger condition.

questions.text: Entropy in information theory for fair coin? (bits)
questions.subject: Probability - Entropy
questions.explanation: Entropy = -∑p log2 p = -2*(0.5*log2 0.5)=1 bit.

questions.text: Which is a sufficient statistic for parameter λ of Poisson?
questions.subject: Sufficiency
questions.explanation: Sum and sample mean carry same information (sum is sufficient; mean is one-to-one with sum).

questions.text: ROC curve plots?

options.text: True positive rate vs False positive rate

questions.subject: Statistical Learning
questions.explanation: ROC: TPR (sensitivity) vs FPR (1-specificity).

questions.text: Bootstrap resampling is used to estimate?
questions.subject: Resampling
questions.explanation: Bootstrap estimates sampling distribution by resampling with replacement.

questions.text: Which process has independent increments?
questions.subject: Stochastic Processes
questions.explanation: Wiener (Brownian motion) has independent increments.

questions.text: Multivariate normal: marginal of subset is?
questions.subject: Multivariate Analysis
questions.explanation: Marginals of multivariate normal are normal.

questions.text: K-means clustering objective minimizes?
questions.subject: Unsupervised Learning
questions.explanation: K-means minimizes within-cluster squared distances to centroids.

questions.text: Which is a consistent estimator?
questions.subject: Estimation - Consistency
questions.explanation: Sample mean is consistent for population mean under standard conditions.

questions.text: Which test compares two proportions?
questions.subject: Hypothesis Testing
questions.explanation: Large-sample test for proportions uses Z-test.

questions.text: Entropy of discrete distribution measures?
questions.subject: Information Theory
questions.explanation: Entropy quantifies uncertainty of distribution.

questions.text: Which matrix appears in multiple regression normal equations?
questions.subject: Regression - Linear Models
questions.explanation: Normal equations: (X^T X)β = X^T y.

questions.text: If p-value < α, we?
questions.subject: Hypothesis Testing
questions.explanation: Small p-value indicates evidence against H0; reject at level α.

questions.text: A 95% CI for mean means?

options.text: Interval contains true mean with 95% probability
If repeated sampling, ~95% of intervals will contain true mean
True mean lies in interval for sure
Sample mean equals true mean with 95% prob

questions.subject: Confidence Intervals
questions.explanation: Frequentist interpretation: long-run coverage property.

questions.text: Which is an orthogonal contrast in ANOVA?
questions.subject: DOE - Contrasts
questions.explanation: Orthogonal contrasts have zero covariance (sum of products of coefficients =0).

questions.text: Which estimator minimizes mean squared error?
questions.subject: Decision Theory
questions.explanation: Bayes estimator under squared error loss minimizes posterior expected loss (MSE).

questions.text: Which kernel density estimate parameter controls smoothness?
questions.subject: Nonparametric
questions.explanation: Bandwidth controls smoothing/variance-bias tradeoff.

questions.text: Boxplot shows median and?
questions.subject: Exploratory Data Analysis
questions.explanation: Boxplot depicts median, IQR (Q1-Q3), and whiskers/outliers.

questions.text: Which is used for model selection penalizing complexity?
questions.subject: Model Selection
questions.explanation: AIC = -2logL + 2k penalizes number of parameters.

questions.text: Design: Latin square controls for?
questions.subject: DOE
questions.explanation: Latin square controls two blocking factors (rows and columns).

questions.text: Which distribution is conjugate prior for Poisson mean?
questions.subject: Bayesian Statistics
questions.explanation: Gamma prior is conjugate to Poisson likelihood.

questions.text: Which is measure of skewness?
questions.subject: Descriptive Statistics
questions.explanation: Third standardized moment measures skewness.

questions.text: Adjusted R^2 differs from R^2 by?
questions.subject: Regression
questions.explanation: Adjusted R^2 penalizes adding predictors that don't improve fit.

questions.text: Which is point estimator of odds ratio in 2x2?
questions.subject: Categorical Data Analysis
questions.explanation: Odds ratio estimator = ad/bc for table [[a,b],[c,d]].

questions.text: Which smoothing method uses local polynomials?
questions.subject: Nonparametric Regression
questions.explanation: LOESS fits local polynomials weighted by kernel.

questions.text: Which is measure of association for ordinal data?
questions.subject: Correlation
questions.explanation: Spearman's rho measures monotonic association for ranks.

questions.text: Which test for goodness-of-fit when parameters estimated from data?
questions.subject: Goodness-of-fit
questions.explanation: Use chi-square with df reduced by number of estimated parameters.

questions.text: Which is bias-variance tradeoff concerned with?
questions.subject: Modeling
questions.explanation: Bias-variance tradeoff balances model complexity and generalization.

questions.text: Which matrix is covariance matrix?
questions.subject: Multivariate
questions.explanation: Covariance matrices are symmetric PSD.

questions.text: If events A and B independent, P(A|B)=?
questions.subject: Probability
questions.explanation: Independence implies conditional equals marginal.

questions.text: Which is method to estimate density nonparametrically?
questions.subject: Nonparametric
questions.explanation: Kernel methods estimate densities without parametric form.

questions.text: Which test for independence in contingency table?
questions.subject: Categorical Data
questions.explanation: Chi-square test assesses independence between categorical variables.

questions.text: Which distribution is used for proportions large-sample approx?
questions.subject: Sampling
questions.explanation: By CLT, sample proportion ≈ Normal for large n.

questions.text: Which is method to impute missing data using model predictions?
questions.subject: Missing Data
questions.explanation: Multiple imputation uses models to create plausible values and accounts for uncertainty.

questions.text: Which method reduces dimensionality preserving variance?
questions.subject: Multivariate Analysis
questions.explanation: PCA projects data onto orthogonal components maximizing variance.

questions.text: Which is used to test stationarity in time series?
questions.subject: Time Series
questions.explanation: ADF tests for unit root (non-stationarity).

questions.text: Which cross-validation splits data into k folds?
questions.subject: Model Evaluation
questions.explanation: k-fold divides data into k groups for validation.

questions.text: Which estimator minimizes absolute deviations?
questions.subject: Robust Statistics
questions.explanation: Median minimizes L1 loss (sum of absolute deviations).

questions.text: Which test compares variance equality between two samples?
questions.subject: Inference
questions.explanation: F-test compares two sample variances ratio under normality.

results.title: Results & Analysis
results.description: Comprehensive analysis of your performance across all sections with detailed insights and recommendations.
